name: What could have been
description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

key_work.title: Interior Light
key_work.brief_description: The works in this room from Vilhelm Hammershøi, William Rothenstein and Philippe Parreno explore undramatic manifestations of light in interior settings, demonstrating its subtle influence on how we experience the world, represented in a way not dissimilar to the work of cinematographers.

constellations_primary.name: What could have been
constellations_primary.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

start.title: Interior Light
start.brief_description: The works in this room from Vilhelm Hammershøi, William Rothenstein and Philippe Parreno explore undramatic manifestations of light in interior settings, demonstrating its subtle influence on how we experience the world, represented in a way not dissimilar to the work of cinematographers.

constellations_primary.name: What could have been
constellations_primary.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

end.title: Interior, Sunlight on the Floor
end.brief_description: Vilhelm Hammershøi (1864–1916) is known for his subdued portraits and meditative interiors which record the details of his everyday life.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

links.description: Interior Light is the sixth section of the Light exhibition, which explores undramatic manifestations of light in interior settings. The work Interior, Sunlight on the Floor is featured in this room alongside other artworks by Hammershøi, Rothenstein and Parreno.

start.title: Interior, Sunlight on the Floor
start.brief_description: Vilhelm Hammershøi (1864–1916) is known for his subdued portraits and meditative interiors which record the details of his everyday life.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

end.title: Incredibles 2
end.creator_credit: Brad Bird, Deanna Marsigliese, John Walker, Nicole Paradis Grindle, Pixar, Walt Disney Pictures, Ralph Eggleston and Aaron Conover
end.brief_description: Elastigirl springs into action to save the day, while Mr. Incredible faces his greatest challenge yet – taking care of the problems of his three children.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

links.description: Interior, Sunlight on the Floor’s original composition remains unseen after the canvas was folded over to omit the depiction of Hammershøi’s wife, Ava. Similarly, Frozone’s wife Honey remains unseen but heard after her scene was cut in Incredibles 2.

start.title: Incredibles 2
start.creator_credit: Brad Bird, Deanna Marsigliese, John Walker, Nicole Paradis Grindle, Pixar, Walt Disney Pictures, Ralph Eggleston and Aaron Conover
start.brief_description: Elastigirl springs into action to save the day, while Mr. Incredible faces his greatest challenge yet – taking care of the problems of his three children.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

end.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
end.creator_credit: Daniel Kwan, Daniel Scheinert, Shirley Kurata, Anthony Russo, Joe Russo, Jonathan Wang, Mike Larocca, Tim Headington, A24, AGBO, Hotdog Hands LLC, Ley Line Entertainment, Year of the Rat Productions and Jason Kisvarday
end.brief_description: An aging Chinese immigrant is swept up in an insane adventure, where she alone can save what’s important to her by connecting with the lives she could have led in other universes.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

links.description: In the sequel Incredibles 2, Elastagirl takes centre stage over Mr Incredible. Similarly, the filmmakers of Everything Everywhere All At Once gender swapped the lead role to cast Michelle Yeoh after their original plan to cast Jackie Chan fell through.

start.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
start.creator_credit: Daniel Kwan, Daniel Scheinert, Shirley Kurata, Anthony Russo, Joe Russo, Jonathan Wang, Mike Larocca, Tim Headington, A24, AGBO, Hotdog Hands LLC, Ley Line Entertainment, Year of the Rat Productions and Jason Kisvarday
start.brief_description: An aging Chinese immigrant is swept up in an insane adventure, where she alone can save what’s important to her by connecting with the lives she could have led in other universes.

constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

end.title: Dream Daddy: A Dad Dating Simulator
end.brief_description: Dream Daddy: A Dad Dating Simulator is a game where you play as a Dad and your goal is to meet and romance other hot Dads. Are you ready? Hi ready, I’m Dad.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

links.description: As audiences see alternate timelines and universes in Everything Everywhere All At Once, players of Dream Daddy can similarly experience many different storylines in this choose your own adventure style game.

start.title: The Wrestler
start.creator_credit: Darren Aronofsky, Amy Westcott, Scott Franklin, Protozoa Pictures, Saturn Films, Top Rope, Wild Bunch, Tim Grimes, Robert D. Siegel and Niko Tavernise
start.headline_credit: France and United States of America, 2008
start.brief_description: Aging wrestler Randy “The Ram” Robinson is long past his prime but still ready and rarin’ to go on the pro-wrestling circuit.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

end.title: Black Swan
end.creator_credit: Darren Aronofsky, Amy Westcott, Kate Mulleavy, Laura Mulleavy, Arnold Messer, Brian Oliver, Jerry Fruchtman, Joseph P. Reidy, Mike Medavoy, Rose Garnett, Scott Franklin, Cross Creek Pictures, Dune Entertainment, Fox Searchlight Pictures, Protozoa Pictures, Thérèse DePrez, Andres Heinz, John J. McLaughlin and Mark Heyman

video_links.name: BLACK SWAN | Official Trailer | FOX Searchlight

end.brief_description: A journey through the psyche of a young ballerina whose starring role as the duplicitous swan queen turns out to be a part for which she becomes frighteningly perfect.

constellations_other.name: What could have been
constellations_other.description: Explore how the historical alteration of Hammershøi’s painting leads us to consider deleted scenes, alternate casting choices and audience agency in storytelling across screen culture.

links.description: Director Darren Aronofsky initially conceptualised The Wrestler and Black Swan as one film “about a love affair between a ballet dancer and a wrestler”. Aronofsky describes these two films as “companion pieces” as several character arcs echo the original project.

links.description: There are many endings that players can be led through to in Dream Daddy. Similarly, the ending of the film The Wrestler is left ambiguous and viewers are left to decide
